title: Collect system state in key-value store instead of pub/sub

content.raw:
At the moment, some system state is only contained in pub/sub redis messages, which are ephemeral.  All state should be collected in the key-value store, so that any client can access that state at any time.  The issue can be seen in certain startup states, wherein the browser that launched a constellation can see the widgets for the launching machines, but a fresh browser window won't see anything until some state change that generates a message.  

And it can happen in failed launch situations that no messages are generated, meaning that only the original browser window can be used to terminate the constellation.  In that situation the workaround is to go into the AWS console and clean up manually.
content.html:
At the moment, some system state is only contained in pub/sub redis messages, which are ephemeral. All state should be collected in the key-value store, so that any client can access that state at any time. The issue can be seen in certain startup states, wherein the browser that launched a constellation can see the widgets for the launching machines, but a fresh browser window won't see anything until some state change that generates a message.

And it can happen in failed launch situations that no messages are generated, meaning that only the original browser window can be used to terminate the constellation. In that situation the workaround is to go into the AWS console and clean up manually.
